message.content: The most significant event that happened in Afghanistan in the past 20 years is the United States-led invasion in 2001 following the September 11th attacks. In response to the 9/11 terrorist attacks, the United States, along with NATO allies, launched Operation Enduring Freedom to overthrow the Taliban regime and dismantle Al-Qaeda, who had been harbored by the Taliban in Afghanistan. This invasion marked the beginning of a protracted conflict and occupation that lasted for two decades.
